perturbation.original_text: 8.2 Termination by Franchisor with Notice. Franchisor may terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days written notice to Franchisee upon the occurrence of any of the following: (a) Franchisee fails to make any payment required under or in connection with this Agreement; (b) Franchisee ceases to operate or otherwise abandon the Smaaash Centres without the consent of Franchisor, or otherwise forfeit the right to do or transact business in the Territory; (c) Franchisee fails to use its best efforts to market and promote Smaaash Centres and the services and products offered by Smaaash Centres within the Territory and such failure is not cured within thirty (30) days of Franchisor's notification to Franchisee of such failure.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 Termination by Franchisor with Notice. Franchisor may terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days written notice to Franchisee upon the occurrence of any of the following: (a) Franchisee fails to make any payment required under or in connection with this Agreement; (b) Franchisee ceases to operate or otherwise abandon the Smaaash Centres without the consent of Franchisor, or otherwise forfeit the right to do or transact business in the Territory; (c) Franchisee fails to use its best efforts to market and promote Smaaash Centres and the services and products offered by Smaaash Centres within the Territory and such failure is not cured within five (5) days of Franchisor's notification to Franchisee of such failure.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for termination to 10 days and the cure period to 5 days may conflict with laws in some states that require a longer notice or cure period for franchise agreements, potentially making the termination clause unenforceable or triggering legal challenges.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Franchise Laws (e.g., California Franchise Relations Act) often require longer notice and cure periods.

perturbation.original_text: 9. Notices and Other Communications All reports, approvals, requests, demands, notices and other communications (collectively "Communications") required or permitted by this Agreement shall be in writing and signed by a duly authorized officer of or such other individual designated in writing by a party. Communications will be duly given if delivered personally, if mailed (by registered mail, return receipt requested) or if delivered by nationally-recognized courier or mail service which requires the addressee to acknowledge, in writing, the receipt thereof, to the party concerned at the following addresses (or at any other address as a party may specify by notice in writing to the other): If to Franchisor: Smaaash Entertainment Private Limited Trade View, Level 2 Kamala Mills Lower Parel, Mumbai 400013, India Attention: Mr. Vishwanath Kotian If to Franchisee: 1345 Avenue of the Americas, 11th floor New York, NY 101015, USA Attention: Mr. Suhel Kanuga
perturbation.changed_text: 9. Notices and Other Communications All reports, approvals, requests, demands, notices and other communications (collectively "Communications") required or permitted by this Agreement shall be in writing. Communications will be duly given if delivered by email to the party concerned at the following addresses (or at any other address as a party may specify by notice in writing to the other): If to Franchisor: Smaaash Entertainment Private Limited Trade View, Level 2 Kamala Mills Lower Parel, Mumbai 400013, India Attention: Mr. Vishwanath Kotian, smaaash@example.com If to Franchisee: 1345 Avenue of the Americas, 11th floor New York, NY 101015, USA Attention: Mr. Suhel Kanuga, iamcapital@example.com
perturbation.explanation: By restricting the method of communication to email only, and removing requirements for confirmation or acknowledgment of receipt, this change increases the risk of notices not being received, which could be problematic under laws that require proof of notice for certain actions (e.g., termination).
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles requiring reasonable notice; Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act (ESIGN) which establishes requirements for electronic records to be considered legally equivalent to written documents.

perturbation.original_text: 10.2 Right to inspect and request information. During the Term, Franchisor shall have the right to conduct audits of Franchisee with respect to the Smaaash Centres, and inspect the Smaaash Centres, after providing a written notice of 5 (five) days. Franchisee shall be under an obligation to provide any information as may be requested by Franchisor with respect to the Smaaash Centres, including the books of accounts and other relevant documents or records maintained in relation to the Smaaash Centres.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.2 Right to inspect and request information. During the Term, Franchisor shall have the right to conduct audits of Franchisee with respect to the Smaaash Centres, and inspect the Smaaash Centres, without any prior notice. Franchisee shall be under an obligation to provide any information as may be requested by Franchisor with respect to the Smaaash Centres, including the books of accounts and other relevant documents or records maintained in relation to the Smaaash Centres.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement for prior notice before audits and inspections could be considered unreasonable and may violate the franchisee's rights. Some jurisdictions require reasonable notice for audits or inspections, especially if they involve access to sensitive financial information. This could lead to legal challenges based on breach of contract or unfair business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing present in most US contract law, which requires parties to act reasonably and honestly in performing their contractual obligations.
